description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21407 in Windows Hyper-V:

1. Ensure your system is compatible with the following builds:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: 10.0.22631.3296
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: 10.0.22621.3296
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: 10.0.22000.2836
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: 10.0.19045.4170
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: 10.0.19044.4170
   - Windows 10: 10.0.10240.20526

2. Apply the relevant KB updates:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: Install KB5035853.
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: Install KB5035853.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: Install KB5035854.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: Install KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: Install KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10: Install KB5035858.

3. You can download the update packages from the following URLs:
   - [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
   - [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858)
   - [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
   - [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854)

**Details**:
This series of updates addresses the use-after-free vulnerability in Windows Hyper-V, preventing potential remote code execution exploits.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure administrative privileges are available for installation.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the updates.
